captions.national-percentage: the percentage of the total number of businesses which had $feature$ employees that  were  in $area$
captions.annual-rate: the annual percentage change in the number of businesses which had $feature$ employees in $area$
captions.ratio: The ratio is the number of businesses which had $feature$ employees in $selectedArea$, relative to the number which had $feature$ employees in $compareArea$
captions.indexed: the number of businesses which had $feature$ employees in $area$ indexed to $firstYear$
captions.percapita: the number of businesses which had $feature$ employees in $area$, per 10,000 people
captions.feature-percentage: the percentage of businesses in $area$ which had $feature$ employees
captions.original: the number of businesses which had $feature$ employees in $area$

indicator.localNumCaption: the percentage of businesses in $area$ which had $feature$ employees in $year$.
indicator.headlineNumCaption: the number of businesses [with $feature$ employees] in $area$ in $year$.
indicator.nationalNumCaption: the percentage of the total number of businesses with $feature$ employees which were in $area$ in $year$.
indicator.name: businesses by employees
indicator.publishers: Statistics New Zealand NZ Business Demography Statistics.

labels.national-percentage: the percentage of the total number of businesses
labels.annual-rate: the annual percentage change in the number of businesses
labels.indexed: the number of businesses indexed to $firstYear$
labels.percapita: the number of businesses, per 10,000 people

notes: Businesses are individual operations engaged in predominantly one kind of economic activity from a single location. Single owner-operator businesses have no employees.
